ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: On Xegony, before the xp patch, a /w all bard count would net 30-40.  That s high end, during prime time, etc. Yesterday afternoon, around 4pm or so EST, the
ygData.messageBody:
On Xegony, before the xp patch, a /w all bard count would net 30-40. That's
high end, during prime time, etc.

Yesterday afternoon, around 4pm or so EST, the count was 74.

I know, I know, hardly scientific or anything, just an observation I've
made.

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeffrey Sue [mailto:jsue@...]
Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 12:35 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message


ok, how many people out of the total subscribers play bards? by the numbers
posted here, less than 5%. by your argument, then bards and their issues
are
insignificant because less than 5% of the people who play everquest are
affected.

it's only insignificant if you're not the one it's affecting.



At 10:13 AM 2/26/01 -0700, you wrote:
>Only for less than 5% of the people, hence its insignificance.
>
> >and you can't really discount pvp, it is a part of the game.
>
>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
